title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.2.2 SOCIAL POLICY

description.narrative: Output 1.2.2 Social Policy and Protection implements effective response policies, programmes and services that target child poverty, including an equitable social cash transfer system, which contributes to Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1.2 Child Welfare Policies and Systems icant progress in addressing key recommendations of international treaties, including the CRC

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.2.2 Social Policy and Protection implements effective response policies, programmes and services that target childpoverty, including an equitable social cash transfer system

description.narrative: Towards universal child allowance: new Law on the State Benefits adopted in 2017 will contribute to achieving substantive coverage of poor and vulnerable by social protection system. UNICEF continues to support the government to make implementation of the law a success. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2018

title.narrative: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

baseline.value: National social protection strategy 2015-2017 prioritises support to vulnerable children and aims for 10 % increase in value of Guaranteed Minimum Income (GMI) annually

target.value: 2017:10 % increase in GMi compared to previous year

actual.value: 2017:GMI level remains the same at KGS 900, however it was not increased due to the introduction of the new law which is expected to bring a greater contribution to the child poverty reduction
